newsitem.title: POLAND: Merger could still be on time-Polifarb W.
newsitem.headline: Merger could still be on time-Polifarb W.

text.p: The planned merger between Polish paintmakers Polifarb Wroclaw and Polifarb Cieszyn might still take place by the end of September as planned despite flooding at Wroclaw, Wroclaw's president said.

Andrzej Platek told Reuters on Thursday that the merger might see no delay despite a statement by Cieszyn's spokesman that the need to appraise flood damage at Wroclaw could push back the merger by at least a month.

"The merger can be delayed if the KPW does not accept the submitted prospectus and current remarks added to it," Platek said, referring to the Securities Commission and an issue prospectus linked with the merger.
Trade in Polifarb Wroclaw has been suspended since July 11 when floodwaters inundated the factory, a fact Cieszyn spokesman Jacek Nagorniewicz said could delay the merger.
"Currently we expect that the whole procedure can be drawn out for at least another month," PAP news agency quoted Nagorniewicz as saying from the southern town of Bielsko Biala.
No one at Cieszyn was immediately available for comment. @
Platek said that damage at Wroclaw would likely be appraised by Monday by the firm and its insurer, PZU SA, after which the company would await a bourse decision concerning its suspension.
He said that after the damage appraisal is sent to the Securities Commission the firm would submit the merger prospectus, which the KPW would likely examine on August 7.
Earlier this week the firm resumed sales and production, which would gradually be expanded.
